items.title: "Gov. Jared Polis will deliver his annual State of the...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Gov. Jared Polis will deliver his annual State of the State address on Wednesday, Feb. 17 at the Colorado Capitol. It's a significant moment for the governor to put his mark on the beginning of the annual legislative session, as well as reflect back on a year unlike any in living history."

Colorado Public Radio

Polis is expected to use the speech to outline his policy priorities and goals for the upcoming months, touching on everything from pandemic stimulus spending to education and transportation reforms.

cpr.org

Almost A Year Into The Pandemic, Polis Will Tell The State Where He Hopes To Go From Here

Polis is expected to use the speech to outline his policy priorities and goals for the upcoming months, touching on everything from pandemic stimulus spending to education and transportation reforms.Polis is expected to use the speech to outline his policy priorities and goals for the upcoming months, touching on everything from pandemic stimulus spending to education and transportation reforms.

items.title: "As a student at the Wyoming Law Enforcement Academy,...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"As a student at the Wyoming Law Enforcement Academy, Albany County Sheriff Aaron Appelhans used to look at the photos of past graduating classes hanging on the wall. 'I got to see, for the most part, ain’t a whole lot of people that looked like me around here,' he recalled of the mainly white faces."

CBS Denver

Aaron Appelhans was appointed Wyoming's first Black sheriff, a post he took months after fury over racist policing roiled U.S. cities.

denver.cbslocal.com

Former Coloradan Aaron Appelhans Becomes First-Ever Black Sheriff In Wyoming

Aaron Appelhans was appointed Wyoming's first Black sheriff, a post he took months after fury over racist policing roiled U.S. cities.Aaron Appelhans was appointed Wyoming's first Black sheriff, a post he took months after fury over racist policing roiled U.S. cities.

items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"After more than 100 years, the inaugural class of female Eagle Scouts was announced last week, with a whopping 13 of the scouts coming from the Denver Area Council."

9NEWS (KUSA)

The girls are between 16 and 18 years old and have collectively completed thousands of hours of volunteer service and dozens of community projects.

items.title: "Today, Bowens uses her bike to get to her job at It Takes...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Today, Bowens uses her bike to get to her job at It Takes A Village, a sexual health clinic on East Colfax Avenue in Aurora. As a low-income essential worker, she qualified for Colorado’s initial 'mini-pilot' for free e-bikes."

The Colorado Sun

By Sam Brasch, Colorado Public Radio Growing up in Los Angeles, Shalon Bowens remembers looking forward to a new bicycle on Christmas morning. The gift was her ticket away from adults and out into the neighborhood, an excuse “to get outside and do something.” Bowens, who now lives in Denver, cou...

items.title: "When students have teachers of color that they can connect...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"When students have teachers of color that they can connect with because they might come from the same backgrounds or they’re into the same things or they just have similar cultures, the students typically do better."

9NEWS (KUSA)

According to the Colorado Department of Education, less than 2% of teachers across the state were Black or African American in the 2019-2020 school year.

items.title: “Now more than ever, we know that racism threatens our...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Now more than ever, we know that racism threatens our collective health as much as the most infectious viruses do. We also know that racism impacts childbirth.”

The Colorado Sun

Now more than ever, we know that racism threatens our collective health as much as the most infectious viruses do. We also know that racism impacts childbirth. To this day, Black and Indigenous women still face rates of mortality, morbidity, and mistreatment much higher than their white counterparts...

coloradosun.com

items.title: “'I remember thinking, I may not be able to do all that,...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“'I remember thinking, I may not be able to do all that, be what she was, but maybe I could do something different than this,' Gullickson says. 'That day, I felt the door open to change and healing.'
Now Gullickson, executive director of the Mental Health & Addiction Association of Oregon, is determined to give other addicts the same opportunity."

USA TODAY

Progressive legislation that decriminalizes all drugs in Oregon looks to give addicts an opportunity for a different life through rehab and treatment.

usatoday.com

Oregon law to decriminalize all drugs goes into effect, offering addicts rehab instead of prison

items.title: "Fort Collins Police Services is introducing a new mental...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Fort Collins Police Services is introducing a new mental health response team to provide better support for community members in crisis. The goal is to increase on-scene safety, make sure community members get the proper care, help avoid unnecessary trips to emergency rooms and create a culture of police-mental health collaboration."

CBS Denver

Fort Collins Police Services is introducing a new mental health response team to provide better support for community members in crisis.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Fort Collins Police Services Create New Mental Health Response Team

Fort Collins Police Services is introducing a new mental health response team to provide better support for community members in crisis.Fort Collins Police Services is introducing a new mental health response team to provide better support for community members in crisis.

items.title: "Cash bail punishes the poor, keeps jails overcrowded, and...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Cash bail punishes the poor, keeps jails overcrowded, and destabilizes people and communities. Illinois just passed a bill to end it, and other states should follow suit. The goal must be to ensure that no one is held in jail who does not need to be there. Legislation needs to focus not just on ending the current system but on what the new one will look like."

The Appeal

Cash bail punishes the poor, keeps jails overcrowded, and destabilizes people and communities. Illinois just passed a bill to end it; other states should follow suit.

theappeal.org

State Lawmakers Must Pass Bail Reform Now

Cash bail punishes the poor, keeps jails overcrowded, and destabilizes people and communities. Illinois just passed a bill to end it; other states should follow suit.Cash bail punishes the poor, keeps jails overcrowded, and destabilizes people and communities. Illinois just passed a bill to end it; other states should follow suit.

items.title: "Among the nine House Democrats set to argue Donald Trump...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Among the nine House Democrats set to argue Donald Trump incited a mob to attack the U.S. Capitol are Reps. Diana DeGette and Joe Neguse. Both Coloradans played pivotal roles in the first impeachment of the former president in late 2019. This time, they will be punching above the state's weight, when the Senate launches the second impeachment trial against Trump this Tuesday."

Colorado Politics

Colorado will be punching above the state's weight Tuesday when the Senate launches only the fourth impeachment trial of an American president, with two of the state's congressional Democrats set

items.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”
